item.title: AMSECast Podcast ‚Äî Numbers that Dazzled the World
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Elmokadem
item.description:
üéôÔ∏è Featured Podcast Appearance: AMSECast

I was invited to join AMSECast for a wide-ranging conversation inspired by my book
Numbers that Dazzled the World, where we explored some of mathematics‚Äô most mysterious and beautiful ideas ‚Äî including:

  • Zero and infinity
  • Irrational and imaginary numbers
  • Universal constants like œÄ, e, and the golden ratio
  • Hidden numerical structure in chaos and nature

Listen to the Episode

üëâ AMSECast Episode Link:
Click here to listen

Episode Description (from AMSECast)

In this wide-ranging conversation, Ahmed El-Mokadem explores the deep ideas behind mathematics‚Äô most mysterious numbers, revealing how concepts like zero, infinity, irrational numbers, and imaginary numbers challenge both logic and philosophy.

He traces how constants such as œÄ, e, the golden ratio, and the Feigenbaum constants appear universally across nature, physics, biology, and technology‚Äîsuggesting they are discovered features of reality rather than human inventions.

El-Mokadem highlights how mathematics repeatedly expands its own boundaries, from accepting imaginary numbers to assigning meaning to divergent infinities through Ramanujan‚Äôs work.

He shows that even chaos follows hidden numerical order, and that numbers long viewed as paradoxical often turn out to be indispensable.

Throughout, mathematics emerges not as cold abstraction, but as a living language that reveals structure, mystery, and beauty in the universe.

The discussion ultimately invites listeners to see math as a bridge between human curiosity and the deep order of the cosmos.

Key Themes Discussed

  • Mathematics as discovery vs. invention
  • The philosophical meaning of infinity
  • Why imaginary numbers are essential
  • How chaos reveals hidden constants

If you enjoyed the conversation, feel free to reach out or explore more writing and projects here on my site.

item.title: CLinical Pharmacology Podcast ‚Äî QSP Modeling in Drug Development
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Elmokadem
item.description:
üéôÔ∏è Featured Podcast Appearance: Clinical Pharmacology with Nathan Teuscher Podcast

I recently joined Nathan Teuscher on the Clinical Pharmacology Podcast for a great conversation about
Quantitative Systems Pharmacology (QSP) and its growing importance in modern drug development.

We discussed:

  • What QSP is and why it matters
  • Where it brings the most value in model-informed drug development
  • Common challenges teams face when adopting QSP
  • Practical ways to overcome those challenges

It was a thoughtful and energizing discussion ‚Äî big thanks to Nathan for having me on!

Listen to the Episode

üëâ Episode Link:
QSP Modeling with Ahmed El-Mokadem ‚Äî Ep. 51

Episode Overview

In this episode, we explore how QSP models can support better decision-making across the drug development lifecycle.

From early discovery through clinical translation, QSP provides a mechanistic framework for integrating biology, pharmacology, and clinical data ‚Äî helping teams make more confident, model-informed decisions.

Whether you‚Äôre new to QSP or already working in the space, I hope the discussion offers useful insights into both the opportunities and the realities of implementing these approaches in practice.

Key Themes Discussed

  • The definition and purpose of QSP
  • How mechanistic models support MIDD strategies
  • Communication and alignment challenges across teams
  • Best practices for building impactful QSP programs

If you‚Äôre interested in QSP or improving decision-making with modeling, I hope you enjoy the episode.
